2019-08-13 13:15
Looking forward to speaking at @JavaScriptCon! In this talk, I'll walk through an example of building an example #JAMstack site which: - Pre-renders all pages as good ol' HTML - Has #serverless fallbacks for new content - Automatically regenerates - Has customisable lollipops 🥳 https://t.co/vABYI8nfCC

Replying to @eQRoeil 2019-08-13 12:58
@eQRoeil @Netlify No way to limit that I'm afraid. The built-in forms handling gives you lots of convenience for things like notifications, automatic API, spam filtering etc... but if you expect a very high volume of submissions, you might prefer to have your form post to a Netlify Function.
